item.title: Sharn add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sharn add a quote by Katherine Anne Porter
item.description: "The past is never where you think you left it." -- Katherine Anne Porter

item.title: Sharn add a quote by Russell Hoban
item.description: "After all, when you come right down to it, how many people speak the same language even when they speak the same language?" -- Russell Hoban

item.title: Sharn add a quote by Janet Frame
item.description: "A writer must stand on the rock of her self and her judgment or be swept away by the tide or sink in the quaking earth: there must be an inviolate place where the choices and decisions, however imperfect, are the writer’s own, where the decision must be as individual and solitary as birth or death." -- Janet Frame

item.title: Sharn add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I didn’t want any flowers, I only wanted to lie with my hands turned up and be utterly empty. How free it is, you have no idea how free." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Sharn add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I desire the things that will destroy me in the end." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Sharn add a quote by Anthony Trollope
item.description: "That I can read and be happy while I am reading, is a great blessing." -- Anthony Trollope

item.title: Sharn add a quote by Anthony Trollope
item.description: "To have her meals, and her daily walk, and her fill of novels, and to be left alone, was all that she asked of the gods." -- Anthony Trollope

item.title: Sharn add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "Things change. And friends leave. Life doesn't stop for anybody." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Sharn add a quote by B. Traven
item.description: "The creative person should have no other biography than his works." -- B. Traven
